deck.definition: FTP Data Transfer (File Transfer Protocol) - Used for data transfer in FTP.
FTP Control (File Transfer Protocol) - Used for establishing the connection for FTP.
SSH (Secure Shell) - Used for secure remote login and secure file transfer.
Telnet - Used for unencrypted communication and remote login (not recommended for secure connections).
SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) - Used for sending emails between servers.
DNS (Domain Name System) - Used for translating domain names into IP addresses.
DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) - Used for assigning dynamic IP addresses to devices.
DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) - Used by clients to receive DHCP offers from servers.
HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol) - Used for standard web traffic and communication.
POP3 (Post Office Protocol version 3) - Used for retrieving emails from a server.
IMAP (Internet Message Access Protocol) - Used for retrieving and managing emails from a server.
SNMP (Simple Network Management Protocol) - Used for managing network devices like routers and switches.
SNMP Trap - Used for sending alerts or traps from SNMP-enabled devices.
HTTPS (HyperText Transfer Protocol Secure) - Used for secure web traffic with encryption.
SMB (Server Message Block) - Used for sharing files and printers over a network.
MySQL - Used by MySQL databases to communicate with clients.
RDP (Remote Desktop Protocol) - Used for accessing remote Windows desktops and servers.
VNC (Virtual Network Computing) - Used for remote desktop access on non-Windows operating systems.
HTTP Alternative - Used as an alternative to port 80 for web traffic, often for testing or proxy servers.
HTTPS Alternative - Used as a secure alternative to port 80 for encrypted web traffic.
IMAPS (IMAP Secure) - Secure version of IMAP, using SSL/TLS for encrypted communication.
POP3S (POP3 Secure) - Secure version of POP3, using SSL/TLS for encrypted communication.
NetBIOS Name Service - Used for name resolution in Windows networks.
NetBIOS Datagram Service - Used for communication and file sharing in Windows networks.
NetBIOS Session Service - Used for establishing sessions in Windows networks.
NTP (Network Time Protocol) - Used for synchronizing clocks across computer systems.
TFTP (Trivial File Transfer Protocol) - A simplified version of FTP, often used for booting devices over the network.
NFS (Network File System) - Used for file sharing across UNIX-based systems.
Oracle DB - Default port used by Oracle databases for client connections.
L2TP (Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol) - Used for VPN connections, often in conjunction with IPSec.
RADIUS Authentication - Used for remote authentication to access networks.
RADIUS Accounting - Used for monitoring and recording user activities in remote access networks.
RDP (Remote Desktop Protocol) Alternate - Alternative port used for Remote Desktop connections.
UPnP (Universal Plug and Play) - Used for automatic device discovery and communication.
PostgreSQL - Default port used by PostgreSQL databases for client communication.
AMQP (Advanced Message Queuing Protocol) - Used for message brokering between distributed systems.
VNC (Virtual Network Computing) - Used for remote access to a graphical desktop.
Redis - Default port used by Redis, an in-memory data structure store.
MySQL - Default port used by MySQL database for client-server communication.
Memcached - Default port used by Memcached, a memory-caching system.
HTTP Alternate - Often used for testing, proxy, or developer web services.
HTTPS Alternate - Used for HTTPS traffic, commonly for testing or services outside the default SSL port.
Tor - Used by Tor, an anonymizing service for internet browsing.
Dynamic or Private Ports - Ports dynamically assigned by the operating system for ephemeral communication.
